item.description:
Estes Lake is a portion of the Middle Branch of the Mousam River, which has been widened by a small dam.  This is the third section of the Mousam we'll be paddling this season.  The northern section of the lake is completely undeveloped and we'll paddle past cattails and other marsh plants with wood duck nest boxes lining the banks.  There are many marshy coves to explore and there should be an abundance of all kinds of birds.  This will be a quiet, bird-filled paddle lasting about 3-4 hours with no current or tides to contend with.  All boat types welcome.

Possible wildlife sightings include: Loon, kingbird, hermit thrush, heron, ducks, cormorants, large- & small-mouth bass, and pickerel.

Rental Kayaks available.

Ask Larry for details.

 

Directions from the South: Take I-95 north to Exit 19/Sanford. Follow Rt 109 north for 9.5 mi. Turn right on Rt 4 & go 3.5 mi. Turn right on Swetts Bridge Rd. Turn right on Stone Rd. Put-in is just past Hay Brook Rd @ the short iron bridge over Hay Brook. (45mins. from Portsmouth)

Directions from Dover: Take Rt 4 north through South & North Berwick toward Alfred, ME. Cross Rt 109 & then continue 3.5 mi on Rt 4. Turn right on Swetts Bridge Rd. Turn right on Stone Rd. Put-in is just past Hay Brook Rd @ the short iron bridge over Hay Brook. 40 mins.

Carpool: Post a comment if you want to carpool and I'll try to facilitate a meeting place depending on everyone's location.

Food. Afterward. Always.  This looks like the place to eat in Sanford, Maine:   Back Street Grill

Liability Release
AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  Fee is for meetup site expenses and planning.
item.name: Estes Lake Adventure (Upper Middle Mousam! )
